NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an element or side of a situation or idea 方面
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You have only considered one aspect of the problem, but there are many.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 权威人士（或机构）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is an authority on plant diseases.

NewWords.WordPhrase: help to cause 促成，有助于，是… 的部分原因
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Various factors contributed to his downfall.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. not refined 粗糙的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His manners are rather crude.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. have control of or a very strong influence on 支配， 统治
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He has authority, but he doesn't try to dominate others.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of an economy or economics 经济（学）的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The country is in a bad economic state.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. go beyond in quantity, degree, etc. 超过
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The cost will not exceed $500.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. real, not fake or artificial 真的，非伪造的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's either a genuine diamond or a very good fake.

NewWords.WordPhrase: yield to 对…让步，屈服于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It seems the President has given way to pressure from hard-liners.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in the course of changing into another state or condition 在过渡时期，在转变过程中
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company is still in transition from one boss to another.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make into a whole 使成一整体
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Foreign immigrants here don't integrate well into the white community.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. declare or tell in advance 预言
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The earthquake was predicted several weeks ago.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n., a. 专业人员（的）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You need a professional to sort out your finances.

NewWords.WordPhrase: free oneself from 使自己摆脱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The country is making attempts to rid itself of corruption.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.，vi. 改变，变动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She hastily shifted the subject.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  (high) social position 地位，身份
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The success of her book has given her unexpected celebrity status.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 客观的，有分量的；重大的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. That is a very substantial improvement in the present situation.

NewWords.WordPhrase: to give just a few examples 仅举几例
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Lots of our friends are coming: Anne, Ken and George, to name but a few.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. general tendency or direction 趋势
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It is obvious from the graph that there is an upward trend in coal production.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. being the only one of its kind 独特的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. None of these social problems are unique to this country.
